node.title: Man returns to Ukraine after wife, 2 children are killed while fleeing
node.description: Sergii Perebeinis wasn't with the family when they died while trying to flee the suburb of Irpin for the capital.

node.title: Uniqlo bows to public pressure to close stores in Russia
node.description: Fashion company reverses course after its CEO previously vowed to keep selling clothes in Russia.

node.title: Public media plan emerges from behind closed doors
node.description: Mediawatch - After more than two years the government has finally confirmed a new media outfit will replace TVNZ and RNZ. Colin Peacock looks at what's behind the public media plan.

node.title: TSA extends mask use on public transportation until April 18
node.description: The directive had been set to expire March 18.

node.title: NZ Rugby apologises for International Women's Day blunder
node.description: The All Blacks have deleted and replaced a social media post celebrating International Women's Day that drew widespread criticism.

node.title: "Black Panther" director mistaken for bank robber, video shows
node.description: Ryan Coogler was approached by police minutes after passing a note to a teller asking her to be discreet over a money withdrawal.

node.title: Grimes and Elon Musk welcomed another baby
node.description: Just like her brother, X Æ A-12, this baby has a unique name.

node.title: What do Russians see and hear about the war in Ukraine?
node.description: "Our government tells us that [the] military operation is going pretty well," one Russian lawmaker told CBS News. Increasingly, that's the only story Russians are getting.

node.title: These are the companies that have pulled out of Russia
node.description: The growing list of companies cutting their business ties in the wake of Moscow's ongoing military assault.

node.title: Watch Live: Jussie Smollett to be sentenced in hate crime hoax
node.description: Smollett faces up to three years in prison for each of the five felony counts.

node.title: Alligator is killed after menacing paddleboarder in viral video
node.description: Florida wildlife officials have killed a nearly 12-foot alligator that swam within inches of a frightened paddleboarder in a popular state park.

node.title: Did common eye drops lead to a SC man's homicide?
node.description: After a millionaire is poisoned with eye drops, his death is ruled a homicide. Did this inspire a copycat crime?

node.title: 5 suspects arrested a decade after killing of iconic boxer
node.description: Camacho and a friend were shot while they sat in a Ford Mustang outside a bar in November 2012.

node.title: Inflation hits new 40-year high, surging 7.9%
node.description: Soaring energy costs are driving the price hikes, while the Ukraine war is expected to drive inflation even higher.

node.title: Funeral worker allegedly steals elderly client's house, life savings
node.description: Authorities say she befriended, then took advantage of an 84-year-old man suffering from Alzheimer's. And they fear there could be more victims.

node.title: "Execution" of 9 people shakes usually peaceful town in Mexico
node.description: A resident told reporters that armed men had arrived in trucks, entered the house and started shooting.

node.title: South Korea elects new leader vowing to teach Kim Jong Un "some manners"
node.description: After years of left-leaning leadership bent on forging diplomacy with North Korea, the key U.S. ally appears set to change its stance on "rude boy" Kim.

node.title: Soaring gas prices spawn conspiracy theories about electric vehicles
node.description: The false assertions being spread on social media would have readers believe the Biden administration is intentionally driving up the price of gas to get more Americans to buy electric cars.

node.title: Man convicted in 1980 murder of 20-year old California woman
node.description: The jury returned the verdict one day after initially deadlocking on the charges. Robin Brooks' sister wept with joy at the jury's decision.

node.title: Accused of hospital strike "war crime," Russia rejects "pathetic outcries"
node.description: U.K. says whether it was deliberate or indiscriminate Russian fire, "it is a war crime," as Russia's foreign minister dismisses it all as lies and propaganda.

node.title: Mummified body found in wall of Oakland convention center
node.description: The decomposition made it impossible to immediately determine the age or gender of the body, the Sheriff's Office said.

node.title: Study shows how gene editing can bring extinct rats back to life
node.description: Scientists used brown rats as the modern reference species, and found they could reconstruct 95 percent of the Christmas Island rat genome.

node.title: Woman sues Cowboys' Jerry Jones, claiming he's her biological father
node.description: It wasn't clear the 25-year-old filed the suit about the Dallas Cowboys owner now. Jones had agreed to support her and her mother financially as long as they didn't reveal his paternity, court documents say.

node.title: High-level Russia-Ukraine talks begin after hospital strike "atrocity"
node.description: With Russia's attack growing more merciless and Moscow and Washington trading claims of biological warfare intentions, hope for a diplomatic breakthrough was low.

node.title: Recap Super Rugby Aupiki: Chiefs Manawa v Matatū
node.description: The Chiefs have pipped Matatū, 17-15, in the first ever Super Rugby Aupiki match at FMG Stadium Waikato.

node.title: Covid strikes Super Rugby Pacific again
node.description: Covid has again hit Super Rugby Pacific, with the Hurricanes unable to field a side against Moana Pasifika in Wellington this weekend.

node.title: Women's rugby: 'We cannot continue to treat female players as second class'
node.description: Opinion - I'd like to believe that New Zealand Rugby and media outlets such as Sky value women's rugby, but I have my doubts, Hamish Bidwell writes.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 21,015 new community cases, 773 in hospital, 16 in ICU
node.description: The daily number of new community cases has dropped slightly today to 21,015 cases, but the number of people in hospital with the coronavirus continues to climb, rising to 773 today.

node.title: Construction sector struggling to retain staff in 'overcooked' labour market
node.description: Desperate construction companies are poaching workers off each other at a destabilising rate.

node.title: Honey company joins efforts to cull wasps
node.description: Comvita says the introduced wasps are a competitor for bees, invading their hives and taking honey and bee larvae.
